result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child-Consequence is Death, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Possession Of A Firearm By A Felon [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders restitution set at $419.44 payable to Crime Victim Compensation.

Provide a DNA sample.  Pay surcharge by the end of supervision period or civil judgment to be entered.
Pay all court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments by the end of supervision period or civil judgment to be entered. Court allows for up to the maximum amount of prison funds to be applied towards fees/costs.  Restitution to be paid first.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Consecutive to count 2 and consecutive to revocation.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No alcohol or illegal drugs.  
No contact with the victims mother or grandmother.
No possession of firearms/weapons of any kind.

Pay supervision fees by the end of supervision period or civil judgment to be entered.
Comply with any other conditions deemed appropriate by the Department.
AODA assessment and successfully complete follow up treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Consecutive to count 1 and consecutive to revocation.

charges.descr: Possession Of  A  Firearm By A Felon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in court with attorneys Colleen A Taylor and Angel Johnson.  Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional Statements by:  Norma J.; Jataveion H.; brianna H.; Sherry H. and Gabriella H.  PSI Reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  State compliant with victim notification.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 25 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence CONSECUTIVE to Count 2 and CONSECUTIVE to revocation, with credit for -0- DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence CONSECUTIVE to Count 1 and CONSECUTIVE to revocation, with credit for -0- DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision as to both counts:  

AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment; 
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol or illegal drugs.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
Seek and maintain full-time employment 
Pay supervision fees; by the end of supervision period or civil judgment to be entered;
Provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge; by the end of supervision period or civil judgment to be entered;
Pay all court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments by the end of supervision period or civil judgment to be entered; Court allows for up to the maximum amount of prison funds to be applied towards fees/costs.  Restitution to be paid first.
Court Orders Restitution set at $419.44 payable to Crime Victim Compensation.
No contact with the victims Mother or Grandmother;
No possession of firearms/weapons of any kind;
Comply with any other conditions deemed appropriate by the Department.
                       

Appellate rights given to defendant.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Filed;  Written explanation of determinate sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Victim Impact Statement received and filed.  bm
Defense's Sentencing Memorandum received and filed.  bm
Defense Sentencing Documents received and filed.  bm
Pre-Sentence Investigation.  Received and Filed.  nk
Order for Pre-sentence Investigation Report.  Signed and Filed.  nk

AS TO COUNT 1.    On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Neglecting a Child - consequence is Death, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.21(2) and (3)(a), 939.50(3)(d), a Class D Felony.

Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor and Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Plea hearing.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2.    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as AMENDED to COUNT 1 and GUILTY as to COUNT 2 and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Count advised Defendant as a convicted Felon, he may NEVER possess a firearm/weapon, and he may NOT vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.

Defense request PSI without recommendation.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
Jury Instructions for Plea Colloquy.  Received and Filed.  nk
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor and Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case calendared for Plea Hearing.  Defense requesting an Adjournment for more time with Defendant to discuss plea.  DEFENDANT TO REMAIN IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY UNTIL NEXT COURT DATE.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Produce signed and filed.  bm
Order to Produce signed and filed.  bm

Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in court with attorneys Colleen A Taylor and Angel Johnson.  Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense has received discovery and request a plea date.  
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense received discovery and requests time to review.  Court grants request.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Rothstein.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Borowski, Br. 12.

Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in court by video with Attorney Colleen A Taylor who appears in person.  Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in custody.  Mallory Davis appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Emanuelson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Michael Anthony Huddleston in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Anthony Huddleston appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/ live/ 4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
